intro: Daviesia implexa, commonly known as the mountain daisybush, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand the dry, harsh conditions of its habitat. Daviesia implexa is often found in heathlands and rocky areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
